p: COVID‐19 also exerts a significant impact on global mental health and plays a different role in the psychological status across countries. For example, Wang et al. 6 report that Poland and the Philippines experience the highest levels of anxiety, depression and stress, whereas Vietnam has the lowest mean scores in these areas among eight countries (China, Poland, the Philippines, Spain, the US, Iran, Pakistan, and Vietnam). Wang et al. 7 highlight that Thailand shows all the highest scores of stress, anxiety, and depression scores, while Vietnam exhibits all the lowest scores among seven countries in Asia (China, Iran, Malaysia, Pakistan, Philippines, Thailand, and Vietnam).
